meanings.definition: To call out or shout in a loud voice to attract attention.
meanings.sent1: She hullooed to her friend across the playground.
meanings.sent2: The coach hullooed to the players to gather around for practice.
meanings.sent3: The children hullooed with joy when they saw the ice cream truck.
meanings.sent4: His voice hullooed through the forest, echoing off the trees.
meanings.sent5: The lifeguard hullooed for help when he spotted a struggling swimmer.

meanings.definition: To greet or hail someone loudly.
meanings.sent1: The crowd hullooed the arrival of the parade.
meanings.sent2: He hullooed his friend from across the street.
meanings.sent3: The dog hullooed the mailman every morning with barks of excitement.
meanings.sent4: The fans hullooed the winning team as they entered the stadium.
meanings.sent5: She hullooed her family with a big smile as they walked in the door.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, cheerful noise to express excitement or joy.
meanings.sent1: The children hullooed with delight when they saw the magician perform.
meanings.sent2: The audience hullooed in approval at the end of the concert.
meanings.sent3: The birds hullooed happily in the trees on a sunny morning.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter hullooed through the room, filling it with happiness.
meanings.sent5: The friends hullooed with joy as they celebrated their reunion.
